en.av_c1: We will use expansion to guess the closed form solution for the recurrence $\mathbf{T}(n) = \mathbf{T}(n-1) + 1\ \mbox{for}\ n > 1; \mathbf{T}(0) = \mathbf{T}(1) = 0$.
en.av_c2.1: When we expand the recurrence for a problem of size $n$, we replace the problem of size $n$ with $1$ unit of work plus a subproblem of size $n-1$:
en.av_c3.1: We replace a problem of size $n-1$ with $1$ unit of work plus a subproblem of size $n-2$
en.av_c4.1: We replace a problem of size $n-2$ with $1$ unit of work plus a subproblem of size $n-3$
en.av_c5.1: We replace a problem of size $n-3$ with $1$ unit of work plus a subproblem of size $n-4$
en.av_c6.1: This pattern will continue till we reach a subproblem of size $1$
en.av_c7: Thus, the closed form solution of $\mathbf{T}(n) = \mathbf{T}(n-1) + 1$ can be modeled by the summation $\displaystyle\sum_{i=1}^{n}1$
en.av_c8: This gives us a closed form solution of $\mathbf{T}(n) = \mathbf{T}(n-1) + 1 = n$
